BackstoryDef.title: bathhouse servant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Growing up as an impoverished child meant that [PAWN_nameDef] had to take up employment instead of going to school. [PAWN_pronoun] undertook the arduous task of cleaning bathhouse customers with a strigil — a tool that rid the client of sweat, dirt and dead skin. \n\nConsidering that most of the bathhouse clientele were minotaurs, whose bodies were covered in fur, [PAWN_nameDef]’s job was extremely tiresome.

BackstoryDef.title: peasant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lead a carefree childhood in a Hellenic tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] and the other calves of the tribe would scurry, wrestle and playfight until sundown, only to arise the following day to repeat the same routine until they each grew too old for it.

BackstoryDef.title: oiketes
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was an oiketes — a domestic slave — treat like a possession by [PAWN_possessive] master. [PAWN_nameDef] undertook a myriad of duties throughout [PAWN_possessive] childhood, such as harvesting crops, tunnelling through clay and tailoring simple garments.

BackstoryDef.title: silver slave
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was pushed down the mines at an early age in search of silver that would “bring prosperity and luxury to all”. Ultimately, [PAWN_nameDef] never got to see such prosperity nor luxury, and was forcibly kept down the mines for most of [PAWN_possessive] childhood.

BackstoryDef.title: military calf
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: As quickly as [PAWN_nameDef] moved from crawling to walking, [PAWN_pronoun] was enlisted to train in the military, as many minotaur calves were. [PAWN_possessive] days started at the crack of dawn and were strict, harsh and physically demanding, which gave [PAWN_nameDef] an incredible sense of self-discipline.

BackstoryDef.title: herbalist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] gathered healing herbs for a wackadoo physician, who cured minotaurs far and wide of their battle wounds and ailments. [PAWN_nameDef] learned well under [PAWN_possessive] master’s counsel and became a walking encyclopaedia of local verdure.

BackstoryDef.title: young messenger
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] trotted back and forth delivering messages from pining lovers, homesick soldiers and worried parents. \n\nNot all of these letters found their recipient intact however, as [PAWN_nameDef] quite enjoyed prizing open envelopes and catching up on the town’s gossip, before amateurishly resealing them and praying not to be found guilty.

BackstoryDef.title: philosopher
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Under the leadership of [PAWN_possessive] tutor, [PAWN_nameDef] spent much of [PAWN_possessive] time contemplating the whims and wonders of the universe. [PAWN_possessive] observations on minotaur anthropology may well be studied by others in the future.

BackstoryDef.title: hetaeros
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lived [PAWN_possessive] life shrouded in mystery, travelling beside wealthy minotaur warriors as what many assumed to be their concubine. \n\nWord spread that it was [PAWN_nameDef]’s intellectual and stimulating company that these warriors coveted on their excursions, but others theorised it was [PAWN_possessive] body that they were truly after.

BackstoryDef.title: misthios
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] secured a post as a vengeful mercenary, brandishing [PAWN_possessive] fists and axe for whomever supplied the gold. The spoils of war — the ones that fell into [PAWN_nameDef]’s pocket anyway — were spent on wonderous luxuries: succulent berries, lush red wine and gowns woven from radiant, soft silk. [PAWN_nameDef]'s life began to revolve around material goods.

BackstoryDef.title: oracle
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lived an ascetic life, deeming [PAWN_objective]self as a means to relay communications from the Gods, and nothing more. Townsfolk often sought [PAWN_possessive] services to request guidance from above in exchange for a generous handful of coins.

BackstoryDef.title: heavyweight
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] dominated the ring in a form of wrestling known as “palé”. Young calves would squabble at the chance to watch [PAWN_nameDef] bulldoze [PAWN_possessive] opponents into the ground, imitating [PAWN_possessive] moves and cheering [PAWN_possessive] name. \n\nThe only thing that [PAWN_nameDef] fears, is what [PAWN_pronoun] cannot fight with [PAWN_possessive] fists: fire.

BackstoryDef.title: chiliarch
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] commanded an army of over one thousand hoplites, each one willing to die at [PAWN_possessive] hand. Fleshbeasts too, kneeled in surrender under [PAWN_possessive] shadow, but [PAWN_nameDef] always had little sympathy for cowards, and ensured that they never felt the sunlight’s bold warmth again.

BackstoryDef.title: rhetorician
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was the needle in the haystack of [PAWN_possessive] community, possessing gripping storytelling and social skills. While many minotaur folktales consist of little more than grunts and moos, [PAWN_nameDef]’s stories had flamboyance, they had drama, but most unusually, they even had words containing over five letters. \n\nEventually, though, [PAWN_nameDef] discovered that what made [PAWN_possessive] purse full wasn’t telling humble bar stories, but using [PAWN_possessive] talents to engage in political diplomacy and persuasion.

BackstoryDef.title: bathhouse attendant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] helped run and maintain the changing rooms of a glorious bathhouse, favoured by influential rulers and generals alike. [PAWN_nameDef] would quip that taking orders from someone was much more humorous when [PAWN_pronoun]’d seen what hung below their waists.

BackstoryDef.title: peasant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lived as a peasant in a Hellenic tribe. [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] days supporting the community as-and-when [PAWN_pronoun] was needed, taking on odd jobs in calf rearing, botany and manual labour.

BackstoryDef.title: citharode
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] played an instrument called the cithara for the entertainment of minotaur soldiers returning home after war.

BackstoryDef.title: bullish academic
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Life in the sheer, unforgiving mountain range of Noxia was harsh on the young [PAWN_nameDef] — but not as harsh as it was for the slaves that erected [PAWN_possessive] home there. \n\nBeing the calf of two highly educated bovines granted [PAWN_nameDef] a gargantuan home, a roster of obedient slaves and some rather unusual traits for a minotaur: incredible academic prowess and total disdain for manual labour.

BackstoryDef.title: traumatised calf
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Not much is known of [PAWN_nameDef]’s childhood, other than the fact that a scolding was sometimes the only form of interaction [PAWN_pronoun] would receive from [PAWN_possessive] parents. A life-shattering incident rendered [PAWN_objective] totally mute — an incident forever sealed between [PAWN_possessive] silent lips.

BackstoryDef.title: troublemaker
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] childhood pulling pranks on travelling humans.

BackstoryDef.title: Astrophysicist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] yearned to uncover the secrets of the stars, and to do that, [PAWN_pronoun] had to step hoof where many minotaur refused to step: human civilisation. \n\n[PAWN_pronoun] worked in a lab with a myriad of funny-looking fleshbeasts, all working together to produce some fantastically articulated research papers. But [PAWN_possessive] bovine temper and unrelenting sarcasm prevented the rift between man and minotaur from ever closing, and the resaearch project eventually fell apart.

BackstoryDef.title: galactic inmate
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was imprisoned for [PAWN_possessive] violent outbursts and was eventually sold on the black market for [PAWN_possessive] meat. Unfortunately for [PAWN_possessive] eventual buyer, [PAWN_nameDef] wasn't an easy minotaur to pin down, leaving not one soul alive to tell the tale of [PAWN_possessive] eventual escape.

BackstoryDef.title: knave
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] went from a selfless village guard to a thieving knave when [PAWN_pronoun] realised what treasures tourists carried in their bags. \n\nThose who wanted to pass through the village were subject to [PAWN_nameDef]’s “suggested” donation of “whatever-is-in-your-bag”, and frankly, many struggled to refuse in the face of an eight-foot minotaur.

BackstoryDef.title: foundling
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] entered the world prematurely and suffered an infancy of poor health. But [PAWN_pronoun] survived. [PAWN_possessive] father, however, couldn't look past the fact that his child stood at half of the height of the other minotaurs, and treat [PAWN_objective] like a failure.

BackstoryDef.title: seafarer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Orphan of war [PAWN_nameDef] was stripped of all but the clothes on [PAWN_possessive] back. [PAWN_pronoun] was captured by colonisers, but during the lengthy sail overseas, [PAWN_pronoun] bonded with, and was doted on, by the crew. [PAWN_pronoun] gained an admiration for seafaring, war and survival.

BackstoryDef.title: botanist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: The mystifying flora around [PAWN_nameDef] perplexed [PAWN_objective], and understanding it was undoubtedly going to be a lifelong pursuit. A pursuit that [PAWN_nameDef] welcomed with open arms. And mouth, should [PAWN_possessive] findings be edible.

BackstoryDef.title: rickshaw
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was forced to pull wagons like a souless animal.

BackstoryDef.title: scrapper
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] speaks one language with total fluency, and that language is bloodshed. [PAWN_nameDef]'s tenure as a gang leader earned [PAWN_objective] an endless list of victims and a body full of scars.

BackstoryDef.title: mullered
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: As a new day dawned, so did [PAWN_nameDef], typically hungover in the doorway of an inn. But starting the day exactly where [PAWN_pronoun] aimed to end it was all part of [PAWN_possessive] drunken plan.

BackstoryDef.title: bullsmith
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] shaped weapons for [PAWN_possessive] fellow minotaurs, no matter how destitute they were. [PAWN_nameDef] believed in arming all those who may one day stand beside [PAWN_objective] in battle. \n\nNaturally, crafting weapons on the double required [PAWN_objective] to work until nightfall, leaving [PAWN_nameDef] with very little time, and confidence, in the means of socialisation.

BackstoryDef.title: peddler
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] traversed over land and sea, peddling [PAWN_possessive] collection of trinkets to willing buyers from all walks of life. \n\nThe dangers that came with the job didn’t frighten [PAWN_nameDef], for any interfering brigands were always willing to hand over their treasures upon persuasion from [PAWN_nameDef]’s mighty fists.

BackstoryDef.title: traitor
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: An ancient legend says that “it takes a minotaur to take down a minotaur”, and [PAWN_nameDef] turned that sentiment into a line of business. [PAWN_objective] captured and sold [PAWN_possessive] own kin to human settlements in exchange for twinkling, golden coins.

BackstoryDef.title: athlete
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Many minotaur cultures celebrate the spectacle of their species’ power through sport. [PAWN_nameDef] trained perilously every day for the chance to participate in these very celebrations, turning [PAWN_possessive] body into a chiseled spectacle for all to see.

BackstoryDef.title: potter
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] scoured the earth for clay to use in [PAWN_possessive] workshop. [PAWN_pronoun] turned it into magnificent pieces of pottery that told the tales of bygone minotaur heroes.
